fields.description:

Immediate_mentioned_notification true/false.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When admin added the following parameter in the {{jira-config.properties}} file set to "-1" (unlimited), the user will not be able to view JIRA issue in Confluence and showed as user does not have the permission or the issue does not exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the following parameter in the jira-config.properties file in JIRA
{code}
jira.search.views.default.max=-1
jira.search.views.max.limit=-1
{code}
#* (!) Please note it's not advised to set to the limit to unlimeted, see [Limiting the number of issues returned from a search view such as an RSS feed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/limiting-the-number-of-issues-returned-from-a-search-view-such-as-an-rss-feed-938847850.html]
# Create application link with Confluence
# Add a jira issue in Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
the issue is displayed without error

h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the parameter in the jira-config.properties file.
fields.summary: User from Confluence is not able to view JIRA issue when there is unlimited jira.search.views. parameters added to jira-config.properties file

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trying to import data into JIRA that contains a custom field with no name (i.e. "") fails with an exception.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create any customfield with name 'xxxx'.
# Rename said customfield with a white space character ' '.
# Re-index Jira

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not allow field to be renamed with white space character only.

h3. Actual Results

Jira allow the field to be renamed with white space character and break Lucene index.


{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$BlankStringArgumentException: names[0] should not be empty!
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.containsNoBlanks(Assertions.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.<init>(ClauseNames.java:42)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.<init>(ClauseNames.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.forCustomField(ClauseNames.java:71)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getClauseNames(CustomFieldImpl.java:281)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.TextSearcher.init(TextSearcher.java:62)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.TextSearcher.init(TextSearcher.java:33)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getCustomFieldSearcher(CustomFieldImpl.java:1502)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.createAssociatedSearchHandler(CustomFieldImpl.java:615)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager$SearchHandlerIndexer.indexSearchableField(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:448)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager$SearchHandlerIndexer.indexCustomField(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:435)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager.getHelper(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:235)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultSearchHandlerManager.getAllSearchers(DefaultSearchHandlerManager.java:202)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.managers.DefaultIssueSearcherManager.getAllSearchers(DefaultIssueSearcherManager.java:27)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.managers.FieldIndexerManagerImpl.init(FieldIndexerManagerImpl.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.managers.FieldIndexerManagerImpl.<init>(FieldIndexerManagerImpl.java:51)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Perform the workaround in the instance that has the problematic data in it.

# Identify the problem record with the below SQL:
{code:SQL}
select * from customfield where cfname is null or cfname = '';
{code}
# Navigate to Administration > Custom Field and find the empty name custom field.
# Rename the field with at least one non white space character
# Attempt a reindex.
fields.summary: An empty name custom field breaks Lucene index

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Historic strings in Jira Server contained a number of formatting errors. For example, Spanish menu titles for Projects, Issues, etc, look really bad on version 7.8.0 - the header title says:

<u>H</u>ome <u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto

 

These strings were fixed quite some time ago, but are still showing incorrectly in the downloadable versions of Jira Server.

If you are spot-checking the property file, you can look at strings in these files:
{code:java}
// grep -r '<u>N</u>' .
/i18n_es_ES.properties:gadget.common.projects.label=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./i18n_es_ES.properties:gadget.common.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./i18n/troubleshooting_es_ES.properties:stp.properties.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/streams/internal/i18n_es_ES.properties:gadget.activity.stream.pref.keys=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/plugins/importer/web/action/util/messages_es_ES.properties:jira-importer-plugin.wizard.step.ImporterProjectMappingsPage=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/plugins/importer/web/action/util/messages_es_ES.properties:jira-importer-plugin.wizard.step.PivotalProjectMappingsPage=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:common.concepts.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:portlet.roadmap.field.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:menu.project.header=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:admin.systeminfo.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:portlet.projects.name=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:portlet.admin.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:alt.text.browseproject=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:alt.text.browseprojects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto
./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_es_ES.properties:workload.developer.report.projects=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto

./jira-quicksearch-plugin_es_ES.properties:ultimate.search.group.projects.name=<u>N</u>avegar por el Proyecto



{code}
I'd like to request that you re-generate language packs, at least for 7.8.0, as we did have a customer requesting this and it would be good to get back with a solution. 

 

Is there a way we can more generally make fixed stings available across a range of Jira Server versions? 

 

 
h3. Workaround

Customer can upgrade to latest version of Jira Server (Core).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Google Chrome, copying an URL from the navigation bar and pasting it on the comment field using the visual mode automatically creates a hyperlink, while copying from other browsers will paste as plain text (as expected).

h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the Chrome 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 # Copy the URL from the navigation bar
# Paste it on the comment field using the "visual mode"

h3. Expected Results
The link renders as plain text.

h3. Actual Results
The link renders as a hyperlink.

h3. Workaround
Paste the URL using the SHIFT+CTRL+V (Past and match style)

fields.description:
Good Day

We are using the Jira Server for Slack integration and I'd like to suggest a feature for this:

The ability to control how the message looks and what content is displayed.

Currently a fixed set of information is displayed. But not all information is needed.

Additionaly the formating is not optimal, the first sentence starts with something like:
[username] transitioned an incident from new to todo
This is also displayed on mobile devices as preview. It would be much better to have the Jira Issuesummary or the like in the first sentence.

To sum it up, the best solution, in my point of view, would be an editor which allows to freely edit the message and let you fill in space with valuables (Issuelink, Reporter etc.).

If this is too much to handle, maybe start with 2 or 3 templates to choose from.

Thank you for your time
Kind regards,

Alain
fields.summary: Jira Server for Slack

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It appears that if the last time a user is Adding/Editing a Comment in Visual mode, the next time the user would like to do the same operation, it will stay in that mode. It would be the same if it is in Text Mode. The problem here is that if the last operation was in Visual mode, editing an existing comment in Safari would not be shown any content at all. It will only show when it is in Text mode after that.

h3. Steps to Replicate.
# Access a ticket from Business or Software Project.
# Add a comment to the ticket in Visual mode.
# Edit the same comment.

h3. Expected Result.
- Comment content will be shown.

h3. Actual result.
- The Comment content goes missing

h3. Workaround
- Before clicking "Cancel" when editing the comment, make sure it is on "Text Mode". After that, Edit the comment again and now the content would not go missing when Visual mode is selected.
fields.summary: Comment content goes missing when Edited on "Visual Mode" using Safari.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using [JIRA Remote Copy Plug-in|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/678725/jira-to-jira-issue-copy] results in heap exhaustion and full GC when using Jira version 8.1.0 and plugin version 6.0.0.

This does NOT occur in Jira v7.6.7 with plugin version 5.1.0.
h3. Environment
 * JAC
 * JAC stg 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an issue.
 # Select More in menu.
 # Select Remote Copy
 # Select a project.
 # Continue through the wizard to copy an issue, press next.
 # Wait 20-30 seconds while the JVM exhausts heap space and a full GC will be triggered. The copy fails and returns to a "copy issue" screen with an alert message:
{code:java}
"The issue can be copied, but there are problems with some fields. Please check the list below"{code}

 # Review Jira GC logs to confirm. I'm including screenshots of GC activity.

h3. Expected Results

Plugin copies issue from one Jira service to another Jira service.
h3. Actual Results

Issues do not appear to be copied. Heap exhausted triggering full GC. 
 See attachments.
   !JAC Prod 10s GC.png|thumbnail!
 !JAC stg repro.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior other than disabling the plugin.
fields.summary: Using JIRA Remote Copy Plug-in results in heap exhaustion and full GC

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As per [JRASERVER-25640|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25640], there is now a JQL to search issues based on the issue link type. However, it is not possible to further refine the search by filtering the results based on the linked issues' resolution.

*Useful scenario:*
* A filter gadget is used to display all the issue the user can work on. 
* The filter is set to display all the issues that do not have linked issues with the type "block", as this is a blocker to the user. 
* Should the "block" linked issue has been resolved, the parent issue should be displayed in the filter gadget so that the user can work on it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce a JQL that can search based on the linked issue's resolution.

h3. Workaround 
Use third-party plugins. Refer to this Community discussion: [How to compare the status of linked issues ?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-compare-the-status-of-linked-issues/qaq-p/825619]
fields.summary: JQL function to display all issues linked by the linked issue's resolution

fields.description:
h3. Definition
In {{catalina.out}}, we could see two different date format such as:
{code}
18-Feb-2019 15:36:57.753 INFO [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start Server startup in 8835 ms
2019-02-18 15:36:57,795 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.j.config.database.SystemDatabaseConfigurationLoader] Reading database configuration from /Users/annamonica/jira_home/JIRA_80/dbconfig.xml
{code}

This is because of JIRA and Tomcat use different formats. 

h3. Suggestion
Standardized the date format as it will help to facilitate centralized monitoring. Analyzing a unified log format is greatly beneficial to monitor application health and facilitate troubleshooting. 

In {{logging.properties}} (taken from [this website|https://www.logicbig.com/tutorials/core-java-tutorial/logging/customizing-default-format.html]) - change the default in {{$jira-install/conf/logging.properties}} to:
{code}
java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.level = FINE
java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler.formatter = java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter
java.util.logging.SimpleFormatter.format=%1$tF %1$tT %4$s [%2$s] %3$s %5$s %n
{code}
Then, restart Jira.
fields.summary: Standardize the Date Format in Catalina.out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira uses files to cache web resources compiled in runtime (less->css, etc).
These files are stored in {{$JIRA_HOME/tmp/webresources}}.

When one of these files is deleted/disappears during application uptime, cache file is not being restored and web resource manager triggers compilation for each request to that resource.

That faulty situation results in a very high CPU load/usage.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove one/many files from {{$JIRA_HOME/tmp/webresources}}
 # Observe load average and CPU usage

h3. Expected Results

- missing cache file is properly detected,
- recompilation happens only once,
- cache file is being restored
- no significant spike on load average / CPU usage is observed (apart from that single compilation event)

h3. Actual Results
- resource files are recompiled for each request
- significant load average / CPU usage is observed

h3. Workaround

Restarting an instance is currently the only known workaround for the issue
fields.summary: Web resource cache doesn't recover properly when it's temporary files are deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Jira uses Beehive library to manage locks on DC, lock is held internally in JVM and also implemented through external table {{clusterlockstatus}} which is shared between nodes. 
Lock is allocated through {{lock()}}/{{unlock()}} methods, which is expected semantics and stardard API.  

Problem: 
 *unlock()* implementation removes the lock but keeps the record {{clusterlockstatus}} table. It's fine in case of the lock with the same name, but there is a problem in case of locks with unique names.  There is no method to clean the old locks, the 'locked_by_node' for that row will be empty, but they pile up in large numbers.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
* Run Jira DC
* Create the unique lock
* Lock the lock
* Unlock the lock

h3. Expected Results
 Once the operation is done, the entry in the 'clusterlockstatus' should be removed (or could be cleaned after some time).  

h3. Actual Results
 'lock_name' entries like "com.atlassian.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager.dashboard-69114" pile up in the 'clusterlockstatus' table. 
{noformat}
  id   |                                              lock_name                                               | locked_by_node |  update_time  
-------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------+---------------
 10505 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_SCHEME_10102          |                | 1542810654292
{noformat}
See JRASERVER-69113, JRASERVER-68477 for some examples. 

h3. Workaround
  If necessary, delete the unnecessary 'lock_name' entries manually.
fields.summary: BeeHive DatabaseClusterLock leaves left-over rows in 'clusterlockstatus' table.

fields.description:
*Summary*
A problem similar to JRASERVER-68477. 
Method {{JiraDashboardStateStoreManager}} after updating/deleting Dashboards on Jira Data Center, allocation the entry in the 'clusterlockstatus' table remains left behind. The 'locked_by_node' for that row will be empty, but they pile up in large numbers.


h2. *Steps to Reproduce*
* Run Jira DC
*  Update/Delete Dashboard

*Expected Results*
 Once the operation is done, the entry in the 'clusterlockstatus' should be removed. 

*Actual Results*
 'lock_name' entries like "com.atlassian.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager.dashboard-69114" pile up in the 'clusterlockstatus' table. 
 One customer had over 7000 of them.

*Workaround*
  If necessary, delete the unnecessary 'lock_name' entries manually.
fields.summary: JiraDashboardStateStoreManager leave left-over rows in 'clusterlockstatus' table.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Often when integrating Jira with other remote applications or services using webhook, there is a requirement from the remote application to provide certain headers  e.g. csrf protection tokens for security or authentication purposes. Jira webhooks provides no way to send custom headers.


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to supply custom header and value in the webhook callback configuration, similar to the feature provided in Jira Service Desk automation webhooks.

h3. Workaround
If your integration is with a Jira Service Desk project, you might be able to send your webhooks using a SD automation rule instead, this allows sending custom headers in the POST request.
fields.summary: Option to add custom headers to be sent in Jira webhook

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira has a couple of disk locations critical for application performance:
* Lucene Index 
* Attachments
* TMP (including _webresources_)
* share NFS (for DC)

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend the current testing tool to have an overview and test all important locations. 

h3. Workaround 
Run manually for specific folders:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
 java -Djava.io.tmpdir=/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/tmp/webresources -jar /var/atlassian/application-data/jira/support-tools.jar
{code}
fields.summary: Test all critical disk location for performance as part of test

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Replying JIRA Notification To Different Mailbox, JIRA Will Create Comment In Original Ticket

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA 7.6.2, JIRA 7.3.9, this is impacting JIRA Service Desk Mail Channel as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 different mailbox in JIRA Incoming Mail
# Create 2 project in JIRA
# Create 2 different mail handler in JIRA with create a new ticket and add a comment
# Configure each mail handler to 1 unique project and 1 unique incoming mailbox
# Now, we got:-
** Project 1 and Project 2
** Mailbox 1 and Mailbox 2
** Mail Handler 1 which connected with project 1 in mailbox 1
** Mail Handler 2 which connected with project 2 in mailbox 2
# Open a ticket in project 1, create a comment or any action trigger notification
(i) You need to have an outgoing mail configured, else no notification will be sent out
# Wait for notification received in your mailbox
# Reply to the notification, update receiver email as mailbox 1 email address
# Reply to the notification again, this round reply to mailbox 2 email address

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA add a comment in project 1 as the email contain in-reply-to header as per JIRA design
# JIRA create a new ticket in project 2 as it couldn't find any ticket in project 2 match this mail header in-reply-to to add a comment

h3. Actual Results
JIRA added 2 comments in project 1 regardless of which mailbox is receiving the email reply.

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: When Replying JIRA Notification To Different Mailbox, JIRA Will Create Comment In Original Ticket
cannot display BigPicture - Work Breakdown Structure

fields.description:
On two separate occasions, newer Jira admins have made the mistake of deleting a custom field context. 

One of the times it happened because it wasn't clear which context they were deleting (they intended to delete another context).

So, the following changes are needed to improve the custom field page layout:
 * Make it more clear which context you are editing or deleting through page design elements
 * Make the edit and delete options harder to misclick
fields.summary: Custom field context page needs UI changes to prevent data disasters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Based on this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0713/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-965543056.html] : 
{quote}If you wish to import any other fields, you can choose to map them to specific Jira custom field(s). If your custom fields don't yet exist in Jira, the importer can automatically create them for you.
{quote}
Custom field values are usually created even when they have a simple typo. This is especially bad for large Jira instances, where admins don't have the time to individually check the custom fields select lists.

As an admin, we would like for it to be possible to throw a warning before creation of a new value, or at least give some information afterwards, so that this is detected fast (and can be dealt with manually).

fields.description:
h3. Denial of service in Apache Tomcat *CVE-2019-0199*

A vulnerability was found in Apache Tomcat version from 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.14 inclusive and 8.5.0 to 8.5.37 inclusive. The HTTP/2 implementation accepted streams with excessive numbers of SETTINGS frames and also permitted clients to keep streams open without reading/writing request/response data. By keeping streams open for requests that utilised the Servlet API's blocking I/O, clients were able to cause server-side threads to block eventually leading to thread exhaustion and a DoS.

 
*Workaround*

Upgrading to Tomcat 9.0.16 will fix the issue.
h4. Fixed Versions
 * >= 8.5.38

 * >= 9.0.16
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to 8.5.38 to fix CVE-2019-0199

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users by default have the option to choose the default *Sharing* setting for when they create new filters and dashboards, which can be either shared with all other users ( *Public* ) or restricted in their User Profile.

Use of this option means that any external clients in the Jira instance can see the names of filters etc which may well be completely irrelevant to them or even business-confidential.

This is because for e.g. any filter shared with 'any logged in user', client users can see the name of the filter. If this name includes e.g. other client names then this is potentially business-damaging.

Due to this, it is important for Jira Admin to have the ability to remove that option from user's profile to avoid any security breach.
fields.summary: Ability to remove option in user's profile which shares their filters by default with all logged in users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User updated event is always triggered when logging in with delegated LDAP authentication.

This problem happens if *Update User attributes on Login* flag is enabled on the directory configuration page.

User updated event should be triggered only when there is actually update of the user on LDAP side.
However, the event was always triggered regardless if there is the update.

h3. Environment

I used OpenLDAP to reproduce this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Connecting to an internal directory with LDAP authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-to-an-internal-directory-with-ldap-authentication-938847055.html]
#- Please enable *Update User attributes on Login* flag
# Repeat to login/logout Jira with a user

h3. Expected Results

# [Jira's webhook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-webhooks-938846912.html] (user_updated event) should be triggered only when there is actually update on LDAP side
# In case that Confluence uses Jira for its user management, "User details updated" [audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/audit-log-829076528.html] should be recorded only when there is actually update on LDAP side
#* In this scenario, you need to synchronize the user directory from Confluence side after the above steps

h3. Actual Results

# [Jira's webhook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-webhooks-938846912.html] (user_updated event) was always triggered when the user logging in Jira
# "User details updated" [audit logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/audit-log-829076528.html] were recorded on Confluence side as many times as the user logged in Jira
#- It results in a flood of audit log on Confluence

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: User updated event is always triggered when logging in with delegated LDAP authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Refresh All Application Links" button in Applications Navigator clears (removes) remote links from UI instead of refreshing them
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.13, JIRA 8.x with application links to multiple remote applications
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example scenario:All applications should remain on the page
 # Deploy JIRA 7.13 or 8.x
 # Deploy Confluence 6.10.1, Bitbucket 5.11, Bamboo 6.7.2 (I believe other versions will do, but I only tried these and customer is using Confluence 6.10.1)
 # In JIRA create Application links to the applications
 # Navigate to JIRA -> Settings -> Applications -> Application Navigator. Notice that all applications are there on the page
 # Hit the 'refresh all application links' button (on the right).

*Expected Results:* All applications should remain on the page
 *Actual Results:* Some applications will get removed (in my case only JIRA stayed)
h3. Cause:

List of remote/external applications is stored in the cache which is cleared (not refresh) by the button. After that site make next request: "/rest/custom-apps/1.0/customapps/list?=<id>". This method returns local app links and remote one which is stored in cache. This cache is refreshed every 10 seconds by default – so if you refresh (cmd+R or F5) this site 10 seconds after you clicked refresh button list should be complete. The problem is with UI. UI should indicate that it still wait for cache invalidation and after that reload list of app links. The interval of cache refreshing is 10 seconds by default and can be set by system property “navlink.navigationlinkscache.delay” but remember if you decrease(<10s) value of this delay you can make Jira slower or starve other threads in environment.
h3. Workaround

a) Wait 10 seconds and perform refresh of the whole page (i.e. F5 or cmd+R)

b)* You can specify the system property with “-D<property>=<value>” JVM flag e.g. “-D navlink.navigationlinkscache.delay=10” (there is no whitespaces)

1. Please go to setenv.sh script and add your option to “JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS” [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]
 2. Restart Jira instance

Please be mindful, workaround b can make Jira slower or starve other threads in environment (i.e. depending on the instance usage it may cause performance impact)
fields.summary: "Refresh All Application Links" button in Applications Navigator clears (removes) remote links from UI instead of refreshing them

fields.description:
*Background*
A major bug was discovered when JSD 4.0.1 / Jira 8.0.1 was rolled out. This caused major functionality loss whereby a couple of key features stopped working. In-product notification was pushed out to instances of JSD / Jira that are on the impacted version.

*Feedback*
The in-product message appears on the "Applications Page" of the Jira UI. This page may not be frequently accessed by users and admins and this delays the time in which stakeholders are informed of the problem.

*Suggestion*
The suggestion is to make the notification more visible, perhaps to include in on the top section of login page/dashboard or etc. This would improve visibility and the stakeholder would get the message rather immediately compared to if he/she stumbled upon the message in the "Applications Page".

fields.description:
Currently, when an email containing an image is sent, the email message contains a direct link to the image.

This can create problems if:
 * the configured mail server uses proxies to cache images, is unable to authorize to Jira, and caches the 403 responses (e.g. when Gmail with the default settings is used as the outgoing mail server)
 * the user is not logged in when viewing the email message, getting authorization error when querying for the image
 * a mailing client is used that doesn't allow to set up a session inside Jira for authentication purposes

As a solution, Jira could give admins an option to embed the images inside emails.
 Such a solution needs to be toggleable, as it adds a potentially expensive step to email creation, e.g. if a user attached multiple big images in one comment.
fields.summary: Allow Jira to embed images in email messages

h3. Summary  
Issue link referred in Visual comment mode followed by additional text goes missing after saving the comment. This appears for issue links after changing project key pattern.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira settings > System > Advanced configuration > change "jira.projectkey.pattern" to some pattern, for example:
{noformat}^([A-Z][A-Z]{0,6}\_{0,1}[0-9A-Z]{2,2}[0-9A-Z\_]{0,1}[0-9A-Z]{0,7})$
{noformat}
# Create a project with key to meet the pattern requirement (e.g. TEST_PROJECT)
# Create two tickets (they get issue keys TEST_PROJECT-1 and TEST_PROJECT-2)
# Link TEST_PROJECT-1 in TEST_PROJECT-2's comment in Visual mode, simply by adding the link and some text before or / and after the link like this:
{noformat}test [TEST_PROJECT-1] test{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Upon saving the comment, mentioned issue key gets rendered as link:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Mentioned issue key doesn't get rendered as link:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Construct link using the following format:
{noformat}test [TEST_PROJECT-1|http://<base_url>/browse/TEST_PROJECT-1] test{noformat}

h3. Note
This behaviour is not reproducible when constructing the link in Text mode.
fields.summary: Issue link referred in Visual comment mode followed by additional text goes missing after saving the comment

h3. Scenario

In a big organization with a lot of JIRA admins, it's not possible to control who can or cannot create WebHooks. Moreover, when a WebHooks is created, an admin can configure it freely which may lead to an unexpected behavior.

h3. Suggestions
1. If possible, allow JIRA System Administrators (not JIRA Administrators) to control who can create WebHooks. This is to be considered in line with JRASERVER-36879.

2. Enable the ability to customize WebHooks configurations in a way that certain conditions must be met e.g. a JQL must be specified or an event must not be selected.

{noformat}^([A-Z][A-Z]{0,6}\_{0,1}[0-9A-Z]{2,2}[0-9A-Z\_]{0,1}[0-9A-Z]{0,7})$
{noformat}
# Create a project with key to meet the pattern requirement (e.g. TEST_PROJECT)
# Create two tickets (they get issue keys TEST_PROJECT-1 and TEST_PROJECT-2)
# Link TEST_PROJECT-1 in TEST_PROJECT-2's comment simply by leaving issue key in the comment:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Upon saving the comment, mentioned issue key gets rendered as link

h3. Actual Results
Mentioned issue key doesn't get rendered as link

h3. Workaround
Construct link using the following format:
{noformat}[TEST_PROJECT-1|http://<base_url>/browse/TEST_PROJECT-1]{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue link mentioned in comment mode goes missing after saving the comment when custom project pattern is being used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever using the Dutch (Nederlands) language, the add-ons page will not load the add-ons. Occurring when the System and also user set the language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language to Dutch (Nederlands)
 # Go to *Administration > Add-ons*  page

h3. Expected Results
The add-ons page will load properly, displaying the add-ons

h3. Actual Results
The add-ons are not loaded, preventing admins from being able to configure it (e.g.: Update license)

h3. Workaround
Use other language
fields.summary: Add-ons are not showing up when using Dutch (Nederlands) language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is possible to release a version containing unresolved issues. You will be presented with an option to ignore and proceed with release, or to move unresolved issues to a different version

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to prevent release of a version if it contains unresolved issues.
fields.summary: Option to prevent release of version with unresolved issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA doesn't correctly create a session token when you access the *{{<Jira URL>/projects/<Project key>/issues}}* page prior to login. If you directly click on the create button and try to attach an attachment a missing token error is thrown. This is rectified by cancelling the issue creation or navigating to the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log off from Jira
 # Go to <Jira URL>/projects/<Project key>/issues
 ** (i) after login automatic redirected to {{<Jira url>/projects/<Project key>/issues/<Issue key>?filter=allopenissues}}
 # Click create button
 # Try to attach a file

h3. Expected Results

Attachment is attached.
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown:
 JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note on fix
*xsrf-token-addition* filter was moved before Dispatcher so in case request is flushed, it will have all necessary XSRF headers. 

h3. Workaround

Cancel the issue creation and try again.
fields.summary: Missing token when attaching a file after login while accessing a project.
JQL Search Special Character Returning Wrong Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When pasting a screenshot in a comment box using Text Mode in board view, the comment box. However, the attachment will be successfully attached. This issue is not observed in Visual Mode or when pasting a screenshot in a comment box in issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to Backlog View of an issue.
 # Add a comment, then, add a message and paste an image from the clipboard using ctrl+v.
 # Attach screenshot dialog box pops up, with the option to enter a
file name.
 # After hitting the "Upload" button, The message "*The files have*
*been attached to xyz issue*" will appear as a floating message.

h3. Expected Results

The comment box disappears completely.
h3. Actual Results

The comment box stays for further edits with the message and pasted image in thumbnail form. 
h3. Workaround

Paste the screenshot in visual mode.
fields.summary: Comment box will disappear when pasting a screenshot in a comment using Text Mode in Backlog view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Import project return error even though Jira have same name custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira with Japanese language
# Create new project A
# Install [WBS Gantt-Chart for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211768/wbs-gantt-chart-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview]
# Add value use the WBS Gantt-Chart
# Create backup XML
# Delete all issues, versions and components of project A
# Import XML to same instance

h3. Expected Results
Import project succeed.

h3. Actual Results
Return following error.
{code}
2019-02-27 06:57:41,855 JiraTaskExectionThread-19 ERROR admin 417x3784x1 icuk9q 172.18.0.1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary!reMapAndValidate.jspa [c.a.j.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService] The custom field 'Finish date (WBSGantt)' of type '日付ピッカー' is required for the import but does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
2019-02-27 06:57:41,855 JiraTaskExectionThread-19 ERROR admin 417x3784x1 icuk9q 172.18.0.1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary!reMapAndValidate.jspa [c.a.j.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService] The custom field 'Start date (WBSGantt)' of type '日付ピッカー' is required for the import but does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Unzip the exported XML
{code}
$ unzip xxx.zip
{code}
# Confirmed the line in {{entities.xml}} which needs to be fixed
{code}
$ grep -n '<english-custom-field-name>' entities.xml \
| grep '<CustomField id='
{code}
(i) Please replace {{<english-custom-field-name>}} with the one you saw in the UI error
# Check the Japanese translation of the custom field
{code}
$ grep '<english-custom-field-name>' entities.xml \
| grep '<CustomField id=' \
| cut -d '"' -f 2 \
| xargs -I{} grep "jira.translation.custom.fieldcustomfield_{}.name.ja_JP" entities.xml \
| cut -d '"' -f 2 \
| xargs -I{} grep '<OSPropertyString id="{}"' entities.xml \
| cut -d '"' -f 4
{code}
(i) Please replace {{<english-custom-field-name>}} with the one you saw in the UI error
# Replace row #2 {{name=xxxx}} to result of #3
# Recreate the XML
{code}
$ zip xxx-fixed.zip activeobjects.xml entities.xml
{code}
# Import {{xxx-fixed.zip}} as usual
fields.summary: Import project return error even though Jira has same custom field name

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to integrate Jira with SIEM tool
fields.summary: Jira integration with SIEM

fields.description: Existing View Usage feature shows when roles are used for schemes or workflows (except inactive workflows or add-on functions, see JRASERVER-44344), but what about projects that have users in the role, regardless of actual scheme or workflow usage? If a role is going to be removed or renamed, then the teams using it need to be alerted. If a team is using a project role that serves no purpose for their project, we could discover that with this feature and alert them.
fields.summary: View Usage for Project Role doesn't analyze projects with users in role

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin I would like an API to manage user directories. For instance to update directory attributes e.g. update ldap.password via script on a schedule based on internal security policies.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a JIRA API endpoint to update User directory attributes.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like an API to update User Directory attributes.

fields.description: It would be great if JIRA issue collector allows only specific list/group of email domain to use issue collector. For example, only user with @mydomain.com able to raise a ticket with issue collector.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector Filter/Limit User Email Domain

fields.description:
Hi guys,

Current behavior when you uninstall an add-on is that the tables will remain there and for big instances this is a nightmare as your database increases significantly due to audit tables, etc. This also has a negative impact on the performance.

My suggestion would be to actually have a tick box that you should check if you want to delete the tables from the database when you uninstall the add-on or leave it unchecked in the situation when you only want to reinstall the add-on.

I hope this will get implemented!
fields.summary: Option to delete add-on tables when uninstalling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During the setup of Jira or while upgrading, if an admin decides to follow the 'Set it up for me' path then after completing it, all plugins' feature flags will be disabled - even the ones that should be turned on by default. This means that any feature provided by a plugin and hidden by such flag will not be available to users. Jira Core's feature flags are not affected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

As this also affects Jira Service Desk, and an example of its feature that would be disabled by this bug is its 'Canned Responses', the steps to reproduce may be following:
 # Download JSD installer for 4.0 (Jira 8.0)
 # Start JSD locally with H2.
 # Once Jira starts - Click on option "Set it up for me".
 # Follow the remaining setup instruction.

h3. Expected Results

As 'Canned responses' is a feature meant to be available by default, its feature flag is turned on.
h3. Actual Results

'Canned responses' flag is turned off, the feature is unavailable.
h3. Workaround
 # Restarting Jira after completing the setup/upgrade fixes the issue (plugin upgrade tasks are executed and feature flags are set appropriately)
 # Follow the 'I'll set it up myself' path in wizard which does not disable plugin feature flags.
fields.summary: Plugins feature flags are disabled when choosing 'Set it up for me' option in setup wizard

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, the only way of adding an issue type to an *issue type scheme* demands a manual work, with the need of editing one issue type scheme at a time.

That becomes an even exhaustive task when there is a big number of issue type schemes in the instance.



h3. Solution

Add an option to edit multiple issue type schemes at the same time.

Perhaps, there could be an additional option in the issue types section (e.g. a button called *add to scheme(s)*), where it would simply display a list with all available issue type schemes with a checkbox next to them, so the user would simply need to check each checkbox (issue type scheme) and click on save to apply the associations.

Another alternative, a CSV import with such settings.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update issue type schemes

fields.description: The version of moment.js used in in Jira before version 7.12.3, from version 7.13.0 before version 7.13.1 and before version 8.0.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service in user's browsers via a regular expression denial of service. For additional details see [https://github.com/moment/moment/issues/2936.|https://github.com/moment/moment/issues/2936]
fields.summary: The version of moment.js used in Jira was vulnerable to a regular expression denial of service

fields.description:
As a Board Administrator I want to edit the filter query and sharing of the board without being tied to a Saved Filter.

Ideally there would be radio buttons to choose from “Board Limited Filter” or “Saved Filter” and an option to copy a “Saved Filter” to the “Board Limited Filter”. Then if it was a “Board Limited Filter” any of that Board’s Administrators could edit the Filter Query / Sharing Permissions of that board without affecting anything else.

Currently when I add a Board Administrator I also have to remember to give them Edit permission to the Saved Filter. Also I can't stop someone else from using a shared filter for their board or widgets meaning I could change the filter and break their board/widgets purpose. It’s an Administrative / Change Management nightmare.
fields.summary: Board Limited Filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a line with an @mention and some text, any text pasted from clipboard anywhere after the @mention is stuck to the mentioned user's display name. This only happens in Visual mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy any text to clipboard using Ctrl+C / CMD+C
 # Write a Comment in Visual mode
 # On a line, mention a user -> type some text -> let the cursor be at the end of the line
 # Paste the text copied to clipboard using Ctrl+V or CMD+V

h3. Expected Results
The text is pasted at the cursor position

h3. Actual Results
The text is stuck to the mentioned user's display name:
!screenshot.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Undoing the pasting (Ctrl+Z or CMD+Z) and redoing it should work
fields.summary: Text pasted from clipboard on the same line after an @mention is stuck to the mentioned user's display name

fields.description:
When opening CSV files exported through the CSV Export of Jira on Excel, if there are written Excel codes on it, they will run automatically.

The suggestion is to provide a setting/configuration that  automatically escape special characters on the export.
fields.summary: Escape code on Description field when exporting to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From [Linking issues - Atlassian Documentation - Create a new linked issue from an existing issue in a service desk or business project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver0710/linking-issues-953145879.html#Linkingissues-Createanewlinkedissuefromanexistingissueinaservicedeskorbusinessproject], only Project, Issue Type and Summary information are carried over.
{quote}The newly created linked issue contains the same Project, Issue Type, and Summary information stored in the original issue.
{quote}
However, for Service Desk projects with participants added to it, the newly created linked issues via *More > Create linked issue* carried over the participants from the originating issue.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * It is NOT reproducible in Jira 7.10.0
 * Reproducible in Jira 7.10.1, Jira 7.12.3, Jira 8.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue in a Jira Service Desk project.
 # Add a participant in the issue.
 # Create a linked issue via select *More > Create linked issue.*

h3. Expected Results

Participants are not carried over in the new issue.
h3. Actual Results

Participants are carried over in the new issue.
h3. Workaround

Manually linking the newly created issue and the original issue via [*More > Link.*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver0710/linking-issues-953145879.html#Linkingissues-creatinglinktoanotherissueCreatingalinktoanotherissueonthesameJirasite]
fields.summary: Creating linked issues in a Service Desk project carried over Participants from original issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For bigger infrastructures, it is essential for Jira Incoming Mail to have a fail-safe system in case the mail server configured for incoming mail is down, the other mail server can automatically take over and process all incoming mail. We can add an optional field in the incoming mail configuration page to add an additional mail server for fail-safe purpose.

For example, if two microsoft exchange server are both set up in a HA-setup. If one is down the other automatically will take over.
fields.summary: Add the ability to enable failover feature for Incoming Mail in Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Jira DC administrators experience a problem with tons of records about their cluster nodes on _System Info_ page in the admin panel. DC enterprise customers restart or kill or add new nodes as part of the everyday activities connected with managing their cluster. All those activities lead to the creation of records in the database and on _System Info_ page under _Cluster Nodes_ bookmark. As a result, administrators see not the actual state of their clusters, but all active & nonactive nodes in a long list that is hard for them to understand and brings more confusion than visibility. This problem becomes more significant in the case of AWS deployments.  

h3. Suggested solution

Since Jira 8.1.0 we would like to provide the (!) experimental REST API which allows Admins in Jira Data Center to manage the state of the cluster. We would like to provide three methods:
 * GET _/rest/api/2/cluster/nodes_ - return all nodes in cluster in JSON format. 
 * PUT  _/rest/api/2/cluster/node/\{nodeId}/offline_ - change the node's state to *OFFLINE* if the node is reporting as *ACTIVE*, but is non _"alive"_ (alive = false). 
** This step could have a negative effect on the cluster consistency, so it's under the discretion of Jira admin. Make sure the node *will not* rejoin the cluster, in another case it will have non-consistent index/cache data. The node can be restarted. 
** The node is marked as non "_alive_" after missing the heartbeat timeout (default 5min). 
** Thus the node potentially could be marked as  *OFFLINE* only after heartbeat timeout. 
** (!) Remember this function is not able to stop Jira instance.
 * DELETE _/rest/api/2/cluster/node/\{nodeId}_ - delete the node from the cluster and database, if state of node is *OFFLINE*.
** Safe to execute

Only Jira System Administrators can execute those methods.

h3. Example
Example response of GET method:
{code:java}
[
 {
  "nodeId": "node3",
  "state": "ACTIVE",
  "lastStateChangeTimestamp": 1551080754927,
  "ip": "localhost",
  "cacheListenerPort": 40001,
  "nodeBuildNumber": 801000,
  "nodeVersion": "8.1.0-SNAPSHOT",
  "alive": true
 },{
  "nodeId": "node1",
  "state": "ACTIVE",
  "lastStateChangeTimestamp": 1551080840469,
  "ip": "localhost",
  "cacheListenerPort": 40001,
  "nodeBuildNumber": 801000,
  "nodeVersion": "8.1.0-SNAPSHOT",
  "alive": false
 }
]{code}
Example usage:
 # Make a request - GET _/rest/api/2/cluster/nodes_
 # Jira returns a list of nodes*
 # Find "*ACTIVE*" and _"alive"=false_ nodes ID in the previous response - e.g. "node1"
 # Make sure that nodes (e.g. "node1") are not running in your environment and will not back to the cluster in the future. 
 #* (!) *They should be stoped*
 # Make a request - PUT _/rest/api/2/cluster/node/node1/offline_
 # Make a request - GET _/rest/api/2/cluster/nodes_
 # Find out that "node1" now has "*OFFLINE*" state
 # Make a request -  DELETE _/rest/api/2/cluster/node/node1_
 # Make a request - GET _/rest/api/2/cluster/nodes_
 # Find out that "node1" was deleted
fields.summary: Add REST APIs methods to clean old node ids in JIRA Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a date is entered by a date picker is then updated manually in the date field to only include 2-digit year, this date is stored as a negative epoch in the database. 
One example of a date is a sprint start date.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the system advance settings.
# Change *jira.date.picker.java.format* to *d/MMM/yyyy*
# Change *jira.date.picker.javascript.format* to *%e/%b/%Y*
# Change *jira.date.time.picker.java.format* to *dd/MMM/yyyy h:mm a*
# Change *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format* to *%e/%b/%Y %I:%M %p*
# Start a sprint with a custom duration
# Pick a date
# Update the date filled by the date picked to only include two digits in the year. For instance, from 28/Mar/2019 04:37 PM to 28/Mar/19 04:37 PM.
# Start the sprint
 
h3. Expected Results
The sprint start date in the DB should be stored as if it was in the year 2019.
h3. Actual Results
The sprint start date in the DB is stored as if the sprint started in the year 0019. Thus, it's a negative epoch. 
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
# SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" WHERE "NAME"='Sample Sprint 4';
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE |    END_DATE     | GOAL | ID |      NAME       | RAPID_VIEW_ID | SEQUENCE | STARTED |   START_DATE
--------+---------------+-----------------+------+----+-----------------+---------------+----------+---------+-----------------
 t      | 1553009870350 | -61559771220000 |      |  9 | Sample Sprint 4 |             3 |          | t       | -61561067201237
(1 row)
{code}
h3. Notes
* This bug breaks reporting done by add-ons such as eazyBI. 
* If possible, Jira should enforce the choice of a 4-digit year in the front end. 
h3. Workaround
The data needs to be fixed manually in the database.
fields.summary: Manually entering a date with a two-digit year results in a negative epoch time in the database when system date settings are set to 4-digit years

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving an issue, the arrow on the dropdown list for the new project is located at the far right. 
h3. Environment
* This issue is only reproducible on Windows in the customer's environment. 
* The issue could be reproduced by Atlassian Support.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Move an issue via *More > Move*

h3. Expected Results
The project dropdown should show properly: 
!10_project_dropdown.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The arrow of the dropdown is located at the far right of the screen: 
!10_project_dropdown_broken.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
This issue could not be reproduced by Atlassian Support. It's put here to gauge interest from other users running into it. 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When moving an issue, the new project dropdown is incorrectly displayed

fields.description:
As a Development team member I would like to be notified when another JIRA user replies to my comment so that we can appropriately collaborate within JIRA.

 

Currently the ability for an original commenter to be notified of a Jira ticket reply is limited by the notification scheme. Original commenter should be added to the notification scheme to allow for comment replies to properly notify the users who commented on their reply.
fields.summary: Comment Replies Should Notify the Original Commenter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the detail view width can't fit all the workflow buttons, the buttons that exceed the width are not one line lower.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project and assign a workflow with 10 transitions to it.
 # [Advanced workflow configuration > Customize how transitions appear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/advanced-workflow-configuration-861253591.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-customisingtransitionsonviewissue] to make sure all button are visible by default. 
 # Search for issues within the project you created in the detail view. 
 # Click on one of the issues in the search results to preview it on the right hand side. 
 # Resize the issue detail view smaller. 

h3. Expected Results
All button should be visible in the issue detail view. They don't have to keep their positions but they should be moved around so they are always visible. 
h3. Actual Results
Jira trims the buttons list and only show what it can fit in the view: 
!14_workflow_button_small.png|thumbnail!
!14_workflow_button_bigger.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
Reduce the number of transition buttons that appear on the screen by default: [Advanced workflow configuration > Customize how transitions appear|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/advanced-workflow-configuration-861253591.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-customisingtransitionsonviewissue].
fields.summary: Workflow buttons disappear when the detail view of issue search is resized smaller

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the workflowSchemeManager.removeSchemesFromProject to remove current workflow scheme of a project resulting to default Jira workflow scheme,_ the previous workflow associated with workflow scheme remains *active_* and the _current workflow scheme is *inactive_* (classic Jira workflow scheme)

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create Workflow Alpha
# Create Workflow Scheme Alpha Container
# Associate Alpha with Alpha Container - all issue types
# Create Project Beta
# Associate Workflow Scheme Alpha Container with project Beta.
# Now Workflow Alpha and Workflow Scheme Alpha Container both show as active and Workflow Scheme Alpha Container shows association with project Beta.
# In your plugin, remove workflow scheme of project thru: {{ComponentAccessor().getWorkflowSchemeManager().removeSchemesFromProject(project);}}

Expected result: 
# Project Beta is associated with the Default Workflow Scheme. 
# Workflow Scheme Alpha Container is not associated to project.
# Workflow Scheme Alpha Container  is inactive(because is not associated with any other project).
# Workflow Alpha is still associated with Workflow Scheme Alpha Container and it is inactive.(because Workflow Alpha is not associated with any other Workflow Scheme).

Actual Result:

# Project Beta is associated with the Default Workflow Scheme. 
# Workflow Scheme Alpha Container is not associated to project.
# Workflow Scheme Alpha Container  is inactive(because is not associated with any other project).
# Workflow Alpha is still associated with Workflow Scheme Alpha Container and it is show as acttive. (even if Workflow Alpha is not associated with any other Workflow Scheme).

h3. Notes
fields.summary: workflowSchemeManager.removeSchemesFromProject doesn't clean up previous workflow scheme
